intro: Lomatium triternatum var. anomalum, commonly known as the anomalous cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clustered umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The species is notable for its medicinal properties and historical use by indigenous communities.
